message_1: Let P be the proposition "I will study mathematics today" and Q be the proposition "I will run for 30 minutes today". Use propositional logic to find the truth value of the statement: "If I study mathematics today, then I will not run for 30 minutes."
message_2:

Q: "I will run for 30 minutes today"

The statement "If I study mathematics today, then I will not run for 30 minutes" can be represented as:

P → ¬Q

To find the truth value of this statement, we need to know the truth values of P and Q. Since we don't have any information about whether you will study mathematics today or run for 30 minutes, we cannot determine the truth value of the statement P → ¬Q.
